channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024030320
item.description:
Report X-2024030320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DROPPED WHILE LOADING. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE. DescribePack: CAN LEAKED FROM UNDER CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024030343
item.description:
Report X-2024030343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package discovered by operations admin Kaeleigh Iles underneath the rollers at door 2. Package immediately placed into hazmat tub for processing. No spillage on the floor or surrounding packages. DescribePack: One cap on one metal cannister failed to operate properly, resulting in a leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in upright position in hazmat tub.

item.title: Report X-2024030344
item.description:
Report X-2024030344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY KAELEIGH ILES UNDER THE ROLLERS AT DOOR 6, LEAKING ONTO A PLASTIC HAZMAT SHEET. IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TUB AFTER DISCOVERY. DescribePack: ONE CAP ON ONE BOTTLE WAS LOOSE AND FAILED TO OPERATE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED ONTO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS BAG BEFORE BEING PLACED INTO A HAZARDOUS MATERIABS TUB.

item.title: Report X-2024030181
item.description:
Report X-2024030181

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic container of degreaser was damaged during either transit or unloading phase. Leak was located at the the cap/seal on the top of container and was not noticed until being removed from IC belt by package handler at designated belt. PH immediately notified me that there was a leaking hazmat. Package was inspected and determined that there was a leak and needed to be processed as such. DescribePack: Metal seal/cap was cracked along seal which caused a small/slow leak from factory seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon inspection, leak was minor and located on the top of container. Leaking hazmat was placed in a blue hazmat bag and then into a yellow hazmat drum
